verses.verse: Now the serpent <WH5175> was <WH1961> more subtle <WH6175> than any <WH4480> <WH3605> beast <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> had made. <WH6213> And he said <WH559> unto <WH413> the woman, <WH802> Yea, <WH637> <WH3588> hath God <WH430> said, <WH559> Ye shall not <WH3808> eat <WH398> of every <WH4480> <WH3605> tree <WH6086> of the garden? <WH1588>
And the woman <WH802> said <WH559> unto <WH413> the serpent, <WH5175> We may eat <WH398> of the fruit <WH4480> <WH6529> of the trees <WH6086> of the garden: <WH1588>

But of the fruit <WH4480> <WH6529> of the tree <WH6086> which <WH834> is in the midst <WH8432> of the garden, <WH1588> God <WH430> hath said, <WH559> Ye shall not <WH3808> eat <WH398> of <WH4480> it, neither <WH3808> shall ye touch <WH5060> it, lest <WH6435> ye die. <WH4191>
And the serpent <WH5175> said <WH559> unto <WH413> the woman, <WH802> Ye shall not <WH3808> surely die: <WH4191> <WH4191>

For <WH3588> God <WH430> doth know <WH3045> that <WH3588> in the day <WH3117> ye eat <WH398> thereof, <WH4480> then your eyes <WH5869> shall be opened, <WH6491> and ye shall be <WH1961> as gods, <WH430> knowing <WH3045> good <WH2896> and evil. <WH7451>

And when the woman <WH802> saw <WH7200> that <WH3588> the tree <WH6086> was good <WH2896> for food, <WH3978> and that <WH3588> it <WH1931> was pleasant <WH8378> to the eyes, <WH5869> and a tree <WH6086> to be desired <WH2530> to make one wise, <WH7919> she took <WH3947> of the fruit <WH4480> <WH6529> thereof, and did eat, <WH398> and gave <WH5414> also <WH1571> unto her husband <WH376> with <WH5973> her; and he did eat. <WH398>

And the eyes <WH5869> of them both <WH8147> were opened, <WH6491> and they knew <WH3045> that <WH3588> they <WH1992> were naked; <WH5903> and they sewed <WH8609> fig <WH8384> leaves <WH5929> together, and made <WH6213> themselves aprons. <WH2290>

And they heard <WH8085> <WH853> the voice <WH6963> of the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> walking <WH1980> in the garden <WH1588> in the cool <WH7307> of the day: <WH3117> and Adam <WH121> and his wife <WH802> hid themselves <WH2244> from the presence <WH4480> <WH6440> of the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> amongst <WH8432> the trees <WH6086> of the garden. <WH1588>
And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> called <WH7121> unto <WH413> Adam, <WH121> and said <WH559> unto him, Where <WH335> art thou?
And he said, <WH559> I heard <WH8085> <WH853> thy voice <WH6963> in the garden, <WH1588> and I was afraid, <WH3372> because <WH3588> I <WH595> was naked; <WH5903> and I hid myself. <WH2244>

And he said, <WH559> Who <WH4310> told <WH5046> thee that <WH3588> thou <WH859> wast naked? <WH5903> Hast thou eaten <WH398> of <WH4480> the tree, <WH6086> whereof <WH834> <WH4480> I commanded <WH6680> thee that thou shouldest not <WH1115> eat? <WH398>
And the man <WH120> said, <WH559> The woman <WH802> whom <WH834> thou gavest <WH5414> to be with <WH5973> me, she <WH1931> gave <WH5414> me of <WH4480> the tree, <WH6086> and I did eat. <WH398>

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> unto the woman, <WH802> What <WH4100> is this <WH2063> that thou hast done? <WH6213> And the woman <WH802> said, <WH559> The serpent <WH5175> beguiled <WH5377> me, and I did eat. <WH398>

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> unto <WH413> the serpent, <WH5175> Because <WH3588> thou hast done <WH6213> this, <WH2063> thou <WH859> art cursed <WH779> above all <WH4480> <WH3605> cattle, <WH929> and above every <WH4480> <WH3605> beast <WH2416> of the field; <WH7704> upon <WH5921> thy belly <WH1512> shalt thou go, <WH1980> and dust <WH6083> shalt thou eat <WH398> all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of thy life: <WH2416>

And I will put <WH7896> enmity <WH342> between <WH996> thee and the woman, <WH802> and between <WH996> thy seed <WH2233> and her seed; <WH2233> it <WH1931> shall bruise <WH7779> thy head, <WH7218> and thou <WH859> shalt bruise <WH7779> his heel. <WH6119>

Unto <WH413> the woman <WH802> he said, <WH559> I will greatly <WH7235> multiply <WH7235> thy sorrow <WH6093> and thy conception; <WH2032> in sorrow <WH6089> thou shalt bring forth <WH3205> children; <WH1121> and thy desire <WH8669> shall be to <WH413> thy husband, <WH376> and he <WH1931> shall rule <WH4910> over thee.

And unto Adam <WH121> he said, <WH559> Because <WH3588> thou hast hearkened <WH8085> unto the voice <WH6963> of thy wife, <WH802> and hast eaten <WH398> of <WH4480> the tree, <WH6086> of which <WH834> I commanded <WH6680> thee, saying, <WH559> Thou shalt not <WH3808> eat <WH398> of <WH4480> it: cursed <WH779> is the ground <WH127> for thy sake; <WH5668> in sorrow <WH6093> shalt thou eat <WH398> of it all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of thy life; <WH2416>
Thorns <WH6975> also and thistles <WH1863> shall it bring forth <WH6779> to thee; and thou shalt eat <WH398> <WH853> the herb <WH6212> of the field; <WH7704>

In the sweat <WH2188> of thy face <WH639> shalt thou eat <WH398> bread, <WH3899> till <WH5704> thou return <WH7725> unto <WH413> the ground; <WH127> for <WH3588> out of <WH4480> it wast thou taken: <WH3947> for <WH3588> dust <WH6083> thou <WH859> art, and unto <WH413> dust <WH6083> shalt thou return. <WH7725>
And Adam <WH121> called <WH7121> his wife's <WH802> name <WH8034> Eve; <WH2332> because <WH3588> she <WH1931> was <WH1961> the mother <WH517> of all <WH3605> living. <WH2416>
Unto Adam <WH121> also and to his wife <WH802> did the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> make <WH6213> coats <WH3801> of skins, <WH5785> and clothed <WH3847> them.

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> said, <WH559> Behold, <WH2005> the man <WH120> is become <WH1961> as one <WH259> of <WH4480> us, to know <WH3045> good <WH2896> and evil: <WH7451> and now, <WH6258> lest <WH6435> he put forth <WH7971> his hand, <WH3027> and take <WH3947> also <WH1571> of the tree <WH4480> <WH6086> of life, <WH2416> and eat, <WH398> and live <WH2425> forever: <WH5769>

Therefore the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> sent him forth <WH7971> from the garden <WH4480> <WH1588> of Eden, <WH5731> to till <WH5647> <WH853> the ground <WH127> from whence <WH4480> <WH8033> <WH834> he was taken. <WH3947>

So he drove out <WH1644> <WH853> the man; <WH120> and he placed <WH7931> at the east <WH4480> <WH6924> of the garden <WH1588> of Eden <WH5731> <WH853> Cherubims, <WH3742> and a flaming <WH3858> sword <WH2719> which turned every way, <WH2015> to keep <WH8104> <WH853> the way <WH1870> of the tree <WH6086> of life. <WH2416>
